intro: Gymnadenia albida, commonly known as the white gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces a tall flowering stem that can reach up to 60 cm in height. Gymnadenia albida is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
